summary: Website for publishing articles (no notes), with an easy editor for updating content and support for adding images; remove public login and ensure only the site owner can publish.
architectural_notes: Scope change: remove the Notes content type from the website; focus on Articles only (public browsing/reading and admin editing).
Scope/behavior change: remove public login/auth; only the site owner can access publishing/editor tools, and visitors can only view published Articles.
Owner-only admin access should be secured via explicit credentials (admin user ID + password) for /admin, while keeping all auth controls hidden from public pages.

existing_features.title: Create a public website that lets visitors browse and read published content, separated into two content types: Articles and Notes, each with its own listing page and detail (read) page.
Provide an authenticated editor/admin experience that allows the site owner to easily create, edit, and update Articles and Notes from the browser (simple CMS).
Add image support so the admin can upload images and embed them in Articles/Notes; images must display correctly on the public pages.
Add basic content management conveniences: draft/published status and a simple publish/unpublish control for Articles and Notes, with only published items visible to the public.

Apply a cohesive visual theme and layout appropriate for an art-focused writing site (distinct typography, generous whitespace, and a neutral, gallery-like color palette), and use it consistently across public pages and the editor.
Generate and include required static brand/visual assets, and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image routing for these static assets).
Remove all public-facing Notes pages and entry points so visitors can only browse and read Articles.
Remove Notes from the admin CMS so admins can only create, edit, and publish Articles.
Update frontend data hooks and query invalidation to remove Notes queries and ensure admin/public data fetching only targets Articles.
Remove all public-facing login/logout and profile-setup UX from the site layout so visitors cannot see or use any authentication controls (no login button, no logout button, no profile setup modal).

Keep the admin/editor pages protected so that only the site owner can access create/edit/publish/unpublish actions; non-owners must not be able to publish articles or upload images even if they discover admin routes.
Adjust admin gating UI text to reflect owner-only access and remove any implication that the site supports general user accounts (use English text).
Update the /admin access flow in the frontend so that a site owner can sign in with Internet Identity and (if needed) claim owner/admin access, without introducing any public username/password UI.

new_feature_requests.summary: Publish articles on the website (create/read views for articles).
Provide an easy way to edit and update articles/notes (simple CMS/editor).
Support adding and displaying images in articles/notes.
Implement backend data models and persistence for Articles and Notes, including fields for: id, title, body, createdAt, updatedAt, and an optional cover image reference.
Disable Notes support in the backend API so Notes cannot be created/updated and cannot be returned from public queries.
Remove the login system/public authentication and restrict publishing/admin editing access to the site owner only (visitors can only read published articles).
Add an owner/admin login mechanism (admin user ID + password) to access the /admin editor, while keeping the public site free of authentication UI.

Implement a one-time backend “owner bootstrap” mechanism that allows the first authenticated Internet Identity principal to claim admin/owner access when no admin has been set yet, and prevents further claims once an admin exists.

projectName: Art publishing website with editable articles/notes and image support
